title: Customising cards
text: typical grid define title, image, link associated card, simplest case produces output like :
code: galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name)   )

title: Customising cards
text: Every card grid uses link two places: title image link target location. However, need specify link. set link = NULL (default), cards displayed exactly way link anything.

title: Customising cards
text: possible create “image ” cards specifying image argument:

title: Customising cards
text: Alternatively, can define “label-” cards contain images, specifying title, text, : Simulated watercolours ggplot2 using transparent polygon method Abstract landscapes generated using ambient Abstract icebergs generated using ambient Collections small flametrees resemble branching plants Trees generated flametree random walk backgrounds Voronoi tessellations seed points sampled iterated function system Simple masks ggfx using flametree-generated textures constraint imposed cards() must include one three main content types: card must title, text, image.

title: Customising cards
text: “body” card comprised image label (.e., title /text), may may associated link. Optionally, can add header /footer appear body. appear muted text, intended inclusion ancillary information: Simulated watercolours ggplot2 using transparent polygon method Abstract landscapes generated using ambient Abstract icebergs generated using ambient Collections small flametrees resemble branching plants Trees generated flametree random walk backgrounds Voronoi tessellations seed points sampled iterated function system Simple masks ggfx using flametree-generated textures
code: galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     text = blurb,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name),     footer = paste("posted on", date)   )

title: Customising cards
text: bs4cards package supports two vertical-oriented card layouts, two horizontally-oriented card layouts, two inset layouts place label transparent overlay top image. select kind layout prefer, specify layout argument cards(). Note, however, layout affects relative position image label. Headers (included) always remain top, footers (included) always remain bottom.

title: Customising cards
text: want vertically oriented cards, set layout = "label-" layout = "label-" (default) create cards: Simulated watercolours ggplot2 using transparent polygon method Abstract landscapes generated using ambient Abstract icebergs generated using ambient Collections small flametrees resemble branching plants Trees generated flametree random walk backgrounds Voronoi tessellations seed points sampled iterated function system Simple masks ggfx using flametree-generated textures
code: galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name),     footer = paste("posted on", date),     layout = "label-above"   ) galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name),     text = blurb,     footer = paste("posted on", date),     layout = "label-below"   )

title: Customising cards
text: set horizontal layouts, set layout = "label-left" layout = "label-right": Simulated watercolours ggplot2 using transparent polygon method Abstract landscapes generated using ambient Abstract icebergs generated using ambient Collections small flametrees resemble branching plants Trees generated flametree random walk backgrounds Voronoi tessellations seed points sampled iterated function system Simple masks ggfx using flametree-generated textures Simulated watercolours ggplot2 using transparent polygon method Abstract landscapes generated using ambient Abstract icebergs generated using ambient Collections small flametrees resemble branching plants Trees generated flametree random walk backgrounds Voronoi tessellations seed points sampled iterated function system Simple masks ggfx using flametree-generated textures
code: galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     text = blurb,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name),     width = "very-wide",     layout = "label-left"   ) galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     text = blurb,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name),     width = "very-wide",     footer = paste("posted on", date),     layout = "label-right",     breakpoint = 7/12   )

title: Customising cards
text: inset layouts place “label” part card floating overlay top image. overlay can appear top bottom, depending whether layout = "inset-top" layout = "inset-bottom": Simulated watercolours ggplot2 using transparent polygon method Abstract landscapes generated using ambient Abstract icebergs generated using ambient Collections small flametrees resemble branching plants Trees generated flametree random walk backgrounds Voronoi tessellations seed points sampled iterated function system Simple masks ggfx using flametree-generated textures
code: galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name),     width = "wide",     layout = "inset-top",      colour = "#ffffffcc"   ) galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name),     width = "wide",     layout = "inset-bottom",      colour = "#ffffffcc",      rounding = 0   ) galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     footer = blurb,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name),     width = "wide",     layout = "inset-bottom",      colour = "#ffffffcc"   ) galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     text = blurb,     footer = date,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name),     width = "wide",     layout = "inset-bottom",      breakpoint = .5,     colour = "#ffffffcc"   )

title: Customising cards
text: tags argument can used assign card set tags, adds toggle buttons top card list user can display cards possessing tag question. tags single string, spaces separating tag. galleries data, paintbrushes variable contains list packages used generating generative art system. ’s generally good idea one tag possessed cards. bs4cards package doesn’t enforce , ’s easy illustrated : ggplot2 ambient flametree rcpp Simulated watercolours ggplot2 using transparent polygon method Abstract landscapes generated using ambient Abstract icebergs generated using ambient Collections small flametrees resemble branching plants Trees generated flametree random walk backgrounds Voronoi tessellations seed points sampled iterated function system Simple masks ggfx using flametree-generated textures
code: galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     text = blurb,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name),     tags = paste("all", paintbrushes),     width = "very-wide",     footer = paintbrushes,     layout = "label-right",     breakpoint = 7/12   )

title: Customising cards
text: Simulated watercolours ggplot2 using transparent polygon method Abstract landscapes generated using ambient Abstract icebergs generated using ambient Collections small flametrees resemble branching plants Trees generated flametree random walk backgrounds Voronoi tessellations seed points sampled iterated function system Simple masks ggfx using flametree-generated textures
code: galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     text = blurb,     link = gallery_url(short_name),     image = preview_url(short_name),     colour = c("#d6cadd", "white", "#c4d8e2", "white",                 "white", "white", "white")   )

title: Getting Started
text: first step using package make sure R markdown document uses version 4 bootstrap. default behaviour R markdown creating HTML documents use bootstrap version 3, setting needs altered. ensure using bootstrap 4, need edit YAML header document specify version bootstrap want use. instructions slightly different depending kind document ’re creating:

title: Getting Started
text: plain R markdown document website (.e., one output format html_document) relevant section YAML might use: overrides R markdown defaults ensure output built using bootstrap 4.5.

title: Getting Started
text: enable bootstrap 4 pkgdown site, process similar identical. Edit _pkgdown.yml file include following Note relies -development feature, may need update development version pkgdown make work.

title: Getting Started
text: Distill R markdown use bootstrap, little inconvenient want use bs4cards distill. little effort possible enable entire bootstrap library distill site, can lead undesirable side-effects bootstrap lot styling doesn’t look visually appealing mixed distill styling.1 fix , bs4cards includes stripped version bootstrap called “strapless”, uses subset bootstrap css relevant cards. convenience function use_strapless() copy strapless css file target location. copy location post: Next, enable library within post, add following lines YAML header post: Alternatively, want enable strapless entire site, markup goes _site.yml file css file go home folder project. ’s done ready go! said, please careful: experimental feature. yet properly tested, functionality (e.g., card filtering) doesn’t work strapless yet.

title: Getting Started
text: main function bs4cards cards(). takes data frame first argument, generally data set bootstrap cards constructed. package comes data set galleries ’ll use create grids row data corresponds one card grid. columns contain information useful constructing cards. example create card grid shown start vignette, needed title card, text printed , image decorating card, URL title image card link. argument cards(), argument can pass expression evaluated using data input: cards() function supports variety different layouts customisation options, discussed next article. give flavour ’s possible, ’s another example based data: ggplot2 ambient flametree rcpp Simulated watercolours ggplot2 using transparent polygon method Abstract landscapes generated using ambient Abstract icebergs generated using ambient Collections small flametrees resemble branching plants Trees generated flametree random walk backgrounds Voronoi tessellations seed points sampled iterated function system Simple masks ggfx using flametree-generated textures
code: library(bs4cards) galleries #> # A tibble: 7 × 5 #>   long_name              short_name   date       blurb             paintbrushes  #>   <chr>                  <chr>        <chr>      <chr>             <chr>         #> 1 Ash Cloud and Blood    ash          2021-07-17 Simulated waterc… ggplot2       #> 2 Ghosts on Marble Paper ghosts       2021-01-09 Abstract landsca… ambient       #> 3 Ice Floes              ice-floes    2021-01-19 Abstract iceberg… ambient       #> 4 Native Flora           native-flora 2021-02-10 Collections of s… ggplot2 flam… #> 5 Silhouettes            silhouettes  2021-01-24 Trees generated … ggplot2 rcpp… #> 6 Track Marks            track-marks  2020-09-20 Voronoi tessella… ggplot2 rcpp  #> 7 Viewports              viewports    2021-02-28 Simple masks wit… ggplot2 flam… galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     link = paste0("https://art.djnavarro.net/gallery/", short_name),     image = paste0("https://bs4cards.djnavarro.net/image/", short_name, ".jpg"),     footer = paste("posted on ", date)   ) galleries %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     text = blurb,     link = paste0("https://art.djnavarro.net/gallery/", short_name),     image = paste0("https://bs4cards.djnavarro.net/image/", short_name, ".jpg"),     tags = paste("all", paintbrushes),     footer = paste("posted on", date),     layout = "label-right",      width = "very-wide",     rounding = "3px"   )

what: An R package for bootstrap 4 cards
title: An R package for bootstrap 4 cards
text: creating R markdown websites, often find wanting organise content nice-looking grid links. goal bs4cards task little easier inside R markdown document website. can install development version GitHub :

title: Construct bootstrap column classes — bs_col
code: bs_col(   base = 12,   small = NULL,   medium = NULL,   large = NULL,   extra_large = NULL,   more = NULL )

title: Construct bootstrap margin classes — bs_mar
code: bs_mar(base = 0, bottom = NULL, top = NULL, left = NULL, right = NULL)

title: Construct bootstrap padding classes — bs_pad
code: bs_pad(base = 0, bottom = NULL, top = NULL, left = NULL, right = NULL)

title: Specifies a bootstrap card — card
code: card(   title = NULL,   text = NULL,   image = NULL,   link = NULL,   image_align = "top",   width = bs_col(medium = 4),   margin = bs_mar(base = 0),   padding = bs_pad(base = 2),   footer = NULL,   header = NULL )
